slide_2.title: Goal of Life on Land (SDG 15)
slide_2.subtitle: SDG 15 seeks to protect, restore, and promote the sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems.
slide_2.paragraph: It includes managing forests, combating desertification, halting biodiversity loss, and protecting wildlife.

slide_3.title: Forests – Earth’s Lungs
slide_3.subtitle: Forests store more than 80% of the world's terrestrial species.
slide_3.paragraph: They absorb roughly 2.6 billion tonnes of carbon dioxide each year. Home to over 1.6 billion people who depend on them for food, shelter, and livelihoods.

slide_4.title: Global Land Degradation
slide_4.subtitle: Over 2 billion hectares of land are currently degraded globally.
slide_4.paragraph: About 75% of Earth’s land surface has been significantly altered by human activity. Soil erosion, desertification, and overgrazing reduce agricultural productivity.

slide_5.title: Wildlife Under Pressure
slide_5.subtitle: Over 40,000 species are listed as threatened on the IUCN Red List.
slide_5.paragraph: Species like the Sumatran orangutan and Black Rhino face extinction due to habitat loss and poaching. Illegal wildlife trade is worth over $20 billion annually.

slide_6.title: Desertification – A Silent Threat
slide_6.subtitle: Affects over 1 billion people worldwide.
slide_6.paragraph: Causes include overcultivation, deforestation, and poor irrigation practices. Leads to food insecurity and migration.

slide_7.title: Case Study – The Amazon Rainforest
slide_7.subtitle: Known as the “lungs of the Earth”, it produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
slide_7.paragraph: Facing rapid deforestation: over 10,000 sq km lost per year. Critical to global biodiversity and carbon balance.

slide_8.title: Solutions and Strategies
slide_8.subtitle: Agroforestry and sustainable agriculture
slide_8.paragraph: Protected areas and national parks Restoration of degraded land through rewilding and planting native species International cooperation (e.g., UNCCD, REDD+)

slide_9.title: How You Can Help
slide_9.subtitle: Support conservation NGOs and eco-certified products
slide_9.paragraph: Reduce meat consumption to lower land use pressure Volunteer for local clean-up or planting events Use digital documents to save paper

slide_10.title: Final Thought
slide_10.subtitle: “If we lose our forests and biodiversity, we lose our future.”
slide_10.paragraph: Let’s be the generation that protected life on land — not the one that lost it.
